name: A Snake in the Grass Quiz | Word Play | 10 Questions

questions.text: I heard last week, that in 1422, King Leo pardoned The Great Pumpkin.
questions.explanation:
Leopard.

	I heard last week, that in 1422, King LEO PARDoned The Great Pumpkin. Leopards are muscular, somewhat solitary cats. They are known for their lovely coats which features a brown backround with irregular black spots. The leopard makes its home in the forested areas of Africa and southern Asia.

questions.text: Take your time, my watch fob is on the top shelf.
questions.explanation:
Bison.

	Take your time, my watch foB IS ON the top shelf.  A bison, often called a buffalo in some locations, is a shaggy, humpbacked member of the ox family. Bison are found in Europe and North America. Buffalo and wisent are both considered to be bison.

questions.text: Once I cut it in half, Roger wanted a piece of my onion pie.
questions.explanation:
Frog & Titi.

	Once I cut it in halF ROGer wanted a piece of my onion pie. The frog is a tailless amphibian. They have smooth skin and a short, rather squat body. The frog has long hind legs that are very powerful and help him to navigate by using a hopping motion.

questions.text: When I lost my pen, Guinevere offered to let me use hers.
questions.explanation:
Penguin.

	When I lost my PEN,GUINevere offered to let me use hers.  The penguin is a large, flightless seabird found in the Southern Hemisphere. They are known for their black and white coloring as well as their ability to live in hostile conditions, and their swimming/diving skills.

questions.text: The gold ingot, found in my backyard, was as large as my fist.
questions.explanation:
Dingo.

	The golD INGOt, found in my backyard, was as large as my fist. The dingo is believed to have been introduced to Australia by the early Aboriginal immigrants. They are usually a sandy brown, medium-sized canine that is considered to be wild, or at most, partially domesticated.

questions.text: By using a lit candle, Muriel sealed the envelope.
questions.explanation:
Lemur.

	By using a lit candLE, MURiel sealed the envelope. Found only on the island of Madagascar, the lemur is an arboreal primate with large eyes and a pointed snout. Their name is derived from the Latin word 'lemures', which means ghost.

questions.text: If we run into a wall, a bystander will help us get up.
questions.explanation:
Wallaby.

	If we run into a WALL A BYstander will help us get up. Native to the island nation of Australia, the wallaby might best be described as a small version of the kangaroo. Wallaby are herbivorous and somewhat social animals. Like the kangaroo, the wallaby is built to hop, and they have a long, powerful pair of legs.

questions.text: An unknown thief stole the boy's terrific new toys from their rooms.
questions.explanation:
Oyster.

	An unknown thief stole the bOY'S TERrific new toys from their rooms. Oysters are common bivalves that have been prized for centuries for their meat. Oysters usually have irregularly shaped shells and are found in shallow water in large groups known as beds.

questions.text: After we were full, a maître de brought us the check.
questions.explanation:
Llama.

	After we were fuLL, A MAître de brought us the check. Llamas are hearty members of the camel family that have been used as pack animals for hundreds of years. Found in the Andes Mountains of South America, the lovely llama is also valued for its soft, warm fleece.

questions.text: Last night, I was eating corn on the cob rabidly, and then my teeth fell out!
questions.explanation:
Cobra.

	Last night, I was eating corn on the COB RAbidly, and then my teeth fell out! Native to southern Asia and parts of Africa, the cobra is one of the most venomous snakes on the planet. When it feels threatened, it puffs up the skin around its neck into a large distinctive hood.
